title: Inductor - energy stored at steady state

content.question: A nonideal battery has <math alttext="e m f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>emf</mi></math> <math alttext="open E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Ɛ</mi></math> and internal resistance <math alttext="lowercase r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi></math>. The nonideal battery is connected in series with a resistor of resistance <math alttext="uppercase R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math> and an inductor with inductance <math alttext="L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>L</mi></math>. Which of the following correctly represents the energy stored in the inductor after the circuit has reached a steady state?

choices.label: <math alttext="U equals, the fraction L over 2, end fraction, times open parenthesis, the fraction open E over uppercase R, close parenthesis, squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>U</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mi>L</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mi>Ɛ</mi><mi>R</mi></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup></math>

<math alttext="U equals, the fraction L over 8, end fraction, times open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator open E, and denominator lowercase r plus uppercase R, end fraction, close parenthesis, squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>U</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mi>L</mi><mn>8</mn></mfrac><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mi>Ɛ</mi><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>R</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup></math>

<math alttext="U equals, the fraction L over 2, end fraction, times open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator open E, and denominator lowercase r plus uppercase R, end fraction, close parenthesis squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>U</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mi>L</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mi>Ɛ</mi><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>R</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="U equals, the fraction L over 2, end fraction, times open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator open E, and denominator lowercase r plus uppercase R, end fraction, close parenthesis squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>U</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mi>L</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mi>Ɛ</mi><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>R</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup></math>

topic.text: 13.5: Circuits with Resistors and Inductors (LR Circuits)

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
